project.name: gridster.js
project.description: gridster.js, a drag-and-drop multi-column jQuery grid plugin

Collision.name: Collision
Collision.description:
Detects collisions between a DOM element against other DOM elements or
Coords objects.

params.name: el
params.description: The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement.

params.name: colliders
params.description:
Can be a jQuery collection
 of HTMLElements or an Array of Coords instances.

params.name: options
params.description:
An Object with all options you want to
       overwrite:

props.name: on_overlap_start
props.description:
Executes a function the first
   time each `collider ` is overlapped.

props.name: on_overlap_stop
props.description:
Executes a function when a
   `collider` is no longer collided.

props.name: on_overlap
props.description:
Executes a function when the
mouse is moved during the collision.

return.description: Collision instance.

Coords.name: Coords
Coords.description:
Creates objects with coordinates (x1, y1, x2, y2, cx, cy, width, height)
to simulate DOM elements on the screen.
Coords is used by Gridster to create a faux grid with any DOM element can
collide.

params.name: obj
params.description:
The jQuery HTMLElement or a object with: left,
top, width and height properties.

return.description: Coords instance.

Draggable.name: Draggable
Draggable.description:
Basic drag implementation for DOM elements inside a container.
Provide start/stop/drag callbacks.

params.name: el
params.description:
The HTMLelement that contains all the widgets
 to be dragged.

params.name: options
params.description:
An Object with all options you want to
       overwrite:

props.name: items
props.description:
Define who will
    be the draggable items. Can be a CSS Selector String or a
    collection of HTMLElements.

props.name: distance
props.description:
Distance in pixels after mousedown
    the mouse must move before dragging should start.

props.name: limit
props.description:
Constrains dragging to the width of
    the container

props.name: offset_left
props.description:
Offset added to the item
    that is being dragged.

props.name: drag
props.description:
Executes a callback when the mouse is
    moved during the dragging.

props.name: start
props.description:
Executes a callback when the drag
    starts.

props.name: stop
props.description: Executes a callback when the drag stops.

return.description: Returns `el`.

params.name: el
params.description: The HTMLelement that contains all the widgets.

params.name: options
params.description:
An Object with all options you want to
       overwrite:

props.name: widget_selector
props.description:
Define who will
    be the draggable widgets. Can be a CSS Selector String or a
    collection of HTMLElements

props.name: widget_margins
props.description:
Margin between widgets.
    The first index for the horizontal margin (left, right) and
    the second for the vertical margin (top, bottom).

props.name: widget_base_dimensions
props.description:
Base widget dimensions
    in pixels. The first index for the width and the second for the
    height.

props.name: extra_cols
props.description:
Add more columns in addition to
    those that have been calculated.

props.name: extra_rows
props.description:
Add more rows in addition to
    those that have been calculated.

props.name: min_cols
props.description: The minimum required columns.

props.name: max_cols
props.description:
The maximum columns possible (set to null
    for no maximum).

props.name: min_rows
props.description: The minimum required rows.

props.name: max_size_x
props.description:
The maximum number of columns
    that a widget can span.

props.name: autogenerate_stylesheet
props.description:
If true, all the
    CSS required to position all widgets in their respective columns
    and rows will be generated automatically and injected to the
    `<head>` of the document. You can set this to false, and write
    your own CSS targeting rows and cols via data-attributes like so:
    `[data-col="1"] { left: 10px; }`

props.name: avoid_overlapped_widgets
props.description:
Avoid that widgets loaded
    from the DOM can be overlapped. It is helpful if the positions were
    bad stored in the database or if there was any conflict.

props.name: serialize_params
props.description:
Return the data you want
    for each widget in the serialization. Two arguments are passed:
    `$w`: the jQuery wrapped HTMLElement, and `wgd`: the grid
    coords object (`col`, `row`, `size_x`, `size_y`).

props.name: collision
props.description:
An Object with all options for
    Collision class you want to overwrite. See Collision docs for
    more info.

props.name: draggable
props.description:
An Object with all options for
    Draggable class you want to overwrite. See Draggable docs for more
    info.

props.name: resize
props.description:
An Object with resize config
       options.

props.name: enabled
props.description:
Set to true to enable
       resizing.

props.name: axes
props.description:
Axes in which widgets can be
       resized. Possible values: ['x', 'y', 'both'].

props.name: handle_append_to
props.description:
Set a valid CSS
       selector to append resize handles to.

props.name: handle_class
props.description:
CSS class name used
       by resize handles.

props.name: max_size
props.description:
Limit widget dimensions
       when resizing. Array values should be integers:
       `[max_cols_occupied, max_rows_occupied]`

props.name: min_size
props.description:
Limit widget dimensions
       when resizing. Array values should be integers:
       `[min_cols_occupied, min_rows_occupied]`

props.name: start
props.description:
Function executed
       when resizing starts.

props.name: stop
props.description:
Function executed
       when resizing stops.

params.name: otions.resize.resize
params.description:
Function executed
       during the resizing.

classitems.description: Disables dragging.
classitems.name: disable

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Enables dragging.
classitems.name: enable

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Disables drag-and-drop widget resizing.
classitems.name: disable

return.description: Returns instance of gridster Class.

classitems.description: Enables drag-and-drop widget resizing.
classitems.name: enable

return.description: Returns instance of gridster Class.

classitems.description: Add a new widget to the grid.
classitems.name: add_widget

params.name: html
params.description:
The string representing the HTML of the widget
 or the HTMLElement.

params.name: size_x
params.description: The nº of rows the widget occupies horizontally.

params.name: size_y
params.description: The nº of columns the widget occupies vertically.

params.name: col
params.description: The column the widget should start in.

params.name: row
params.description: The row the widget should start in.

params.name: max_size
params.description: max_size Maximun size (in units) for width and height.

params.name: min_size
params.description: min_size Minimum size (in units) for width and height.

return.description:
Returns the jQuery wrapped HTMLElement representing.
 the widget that was just created.

classitems.description: Change widget size limits.
classitems.name: set_widget_min_size

params.name: $widget
params.description:
The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement
 representing the widget or an index representing the desired widget.

params.name: min_size
params.description: Minimum size (in units) for width and height.

return.description: Returns instance of gridster Class.

classitems.description: Change widget size limits.
classitems.name: set_widget_max_size

params.name: $widget
params.description:
The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement
 representing the widget or an index representing the desired widget.

params.name: max_size
params.description: Maximun size (in units) for width and height.

return.description: Returns instance of gridster Class.

classitems.description: Append the resize handle into a widget.
classitems.name: add_resize_handle

params.name: $widget
params.description:
The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement
 representing the widget.

return.description: Returns instance of gridster Class.

classitems.description: Change the size of a widget. Width is limited to the current grid width.
classitems.name: resize_widget

params.name: $widget
params.description:
The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement
 representing the widget.

params.name: size_x
params.description: The number of columns that will occupy the widget. By default size_x is limited to the space available from the column where the widget begins, until the last column to the right.

params.name: size_y
params.description: The number of rows that will occupy the widget.

params.name: callback
params.description: Function executed when the widget is removed.

return.description: Returns $widget.

classitems.description: Mutate widget dimensions and position in the grid map.
classitems.name: mutate_widget_in_gridmap

params.name: $widget
params.description:
The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement
 representing the widget to mutate.

params.name: wgd
params.description: Current widget grid data (col, row, size_x, size_y).

params.name: new_wgd
params.description: New widget grid data.

return.description: Returns instance of gridster Class.

classitems.description:
Move down widgets in cells represented by the arguments col, row, size_x,
size_y
classitems.name: empty_cells

params.name: col
params.description: The column where the group of cells begin.

params.name: row
params.description: The row where the group of cells begin.

params.name: size_x
params.description:
The number of columns that the group of cells
occupy.

params.name: size_y
params.description:
The number of rows that the group of cells
occupy.

params.name: $exclude
params.description: Exclude widgets from being moved.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description:
Move up widgets below cells represented by the arguments col, row, size_x,
size_y.
classitems.name: remove_empty_cells

params.name: col
params.description: The column where the group of cells begin.

params.name: row
params.description: The row where the group of cells begin.

params.name: size_x
params.description:
The number of columns that the group of cells
occupy.

params.name: size_y
params.description:
The number of rows that the group of cells
occupy.

params.name: exclude
params.description: Exclude widgets from being moved.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Get the most left column below to add a new widget.
classitems.name: next_position

params.name: size_x
params.description: The nº of rows the widget occupies horizontally.

params.name: size_y
params.description: The nº of columns the widget occupies vertically.

return.description:
Returns a grid coords object representing the future
 widget coords.

classitems.description: Remove a widget from the grid.
classitems.name: remove_widget

params.name: el
params.description: The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement you want to remove.

params.name: silent
params.description:
If true, widgets below the removed one
will not move up. If a Function is passed it will be used as callback.

params.name: callback
params.description: Function executed when the widget is removed.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Remove all widgets from the grid.
classitems.name: remove_all_widgets

params.name: callback
params.description: Function executed for each widget removed.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Returns a serialized array of the widgets in the grid.
classitems.name: serialize

params.name: $widgets
params.description:
The collection of jQuery wrapped
 HTMLElements you want to serialize. If no argument is passed all widgets
 will be serialized.

return.description:
Returns an Array of Objects with the data specified in
 the serialize_params option.

classitems.description:
Returns a serialized array of the widgets that have changed their
 position.
classitems.name: serialize_changed

return.description:
Returns an Array of Objects with the data specified in
 the serialize_params option.

classitems.description:
Creates the grid coords object representing the widget a add it to the
mapped array of positions.
classitems.name: register_widget

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description:
Update in the mapped array of positions the value of cells represented by
the grid coords object passed in the `grid_data` param.

params.description:
The grid coords object representing the cells
 to update in the mapped array.

params.name: value
params.description:
Pass `false` or the jQuery wrapped
 HTMLElement, depends if you want to delete an existing position or add
 a new one.

classitems.name: update_widget_position

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

The grid coords object representing the cells
 to update in the mapped array.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

The grid coords object representing the cells
 to update in the mapped array.

params.description:
The value to set in the specified
 position .

classitems.description:
Executes the callbacks passed as arguments when a column begins to be
overlapped or stops being overlapped.

params.name: start_callback
params.description:
Function executed when a new column
 begins to be overlapped. The column is passed as first argument.

params.name: stop_callback
params.description:
Function executed when a column stops
 being overlapped. The column is passed as first argument.

classitems.name: on_overlapped_column_change

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description:
Executes the callbacks passed as arguments when a row starts to be
overlapped or stops being overlapped.

params.name: start_callback
params.description:
Function executed when a new row begins
 to be overlapped. The row is passed as first argument.

params.name: end_callback
params.description:
Function executed when a row stops being
 overlapped. The row is passed as first argument.

classitems.name: on_overlapped_row_change

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Sets the current position of the player
classitems.name: set_player

classitems.description:
See which of the widgets in the $widgets param collection can go to
a upper row and which not.
classitems.name: widgets_contraints

params.name: $widgets
params.description:
A jQuery wrapped collection of
HTMLElements.

return.description:
Returns a literal Object with two keys: `can_go_up` &
`can_not_go_up`. Each contains a set of HTMLElements.

classitems.description:
Sorts an Array of grid coords objects (representing the grid coords of
each widget) in ascending way.
classitems.name: sort_by_row_asc

params.name: widgets
params.description: Array of grid coords objects

return.description: Returns the array sorted.

classitems.description:
Sorts an Array of grid coords objects (representing the grid coords of
each widget) placing first the empty cells upper left.
classitems.name: sort_by_row_and_col_asc

params.name: widgets
params.description: Array of grid coords objects

return.description: Returns the array sorted.

classitems.description:
Sorts an Array of grid coords objects by column (representing the grid
coords of each widget) in ascending way.
classitems.name: sort_by_col_asc

params.name: widgets
params.description: Array of grid coords objects

return.description: Returns the array sorted.

classitems.description:
Sorts an Array of grid coords objects (representing the grid coords of
each widget) in descending way.
classitems.name: sort_by_row_desc

params.name: widgets
params.description: Array of grid coords objects

return.description: Returns the array sorted.

classitems.description:
Sorts an Array of grid coords objects (representing the grid coords of
each widget) in descending way.

A jQuery collection of HTMLElements

Returns false if there is no widget,
else returns the jQuery HTMLElement

Determines if there is a widget in the cell represented by col/row
params and if this is under the widget that is being dragged.

Get widgets overlapping with the player or with the object passed
representing the grid cells.

The column to which we want to move the
 placeholder.

classitems.description: Determines whether the player can move to a position above.

The actual grid coords object of the
 player.

If the player can be moved to an upper row

The actual grid coords object of the

If the widget can be moved to an upper row

classitems.description:
Search a valid row for the widget represented by `widget_grid_data' in
the `upper_rows` array. Iteration starts from row specified in `min_row`.
classitems.name: get_valid_rows

params.name: widget_grid_data
params.description:
The actual grid coords object of the
 player.

params.name: upper_rows
params.description:
An array with columns as index and arrays
 of valid rows as values.

params.name: min_row
params.description: The upper row from which the iteration will start.

return.description:
Returns the upper row valid from the `upper_rows`
 for the widget in question.

The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement of the

Check if it's possible to move a widget to a specific col/row. It takes

 coords object) the widget occupies.

each one.

The grid coords object that represents the

The function to execute on each column

Iterate over the columns occupied by a widget executing a function for
each one.

params.name: el_grid_data
params.description:
The grid coords object that represents
 the widget.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function to execute on each column
 iteration. The column number is passed as first argument.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description:
Iterate over the rows occupied by a widget executing a function for
each one.
classitems.name: for_each_row_occupied

params.name: el_grid_data
params.description:
The grid coords object that represents
 the widget.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function to execute on each column
 iteration. The row number is passed as first argument.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Iterate over each widget above the column and row specified.
classitems.name: for_each_widget_above

params.name: col
params.description: The column to start iterating.

params.name: row
params.description: The row to start iterating.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function to execute on each widget
 iteration. The value of `this` inside the function is the jQuery
 wrapped HTMLElement.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Iterate over each widget below the column and row specified.
classitems.name: for_each_widget_below

params.name: col
params.description: The column to start iterating.

params.name: row
params.description: The row to start iterating.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function to execute on each widget
 iteration. The value of `this` inside the function is the jQuery wrapped
 HTMLElement.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Returns the highest occupied cell in the grid.
classitems.name: get_highest_occupied_cell

return.description: Returns an object with `col` and `row` numbers.

classitems.description: Set the current height of the parent grid.
classitems.name: set_dom_grid_height

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Set the current width of the parent grid.
classitems.name: set_dom_grid_width

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: It generates the neccessary styles to position the widgets.
classitems.name: generate_stylesheet

params.name: rows
params.description: Number of columns.

params.name: cols
params.description: Number of rows.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Injects the given CSS as string to the head of the document.
classitems.name: add_style_tag

params.name: css
params.description: The styles to apply.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Remove the style tag with the associated id from the head of the document
classitems.name: remove_style_tag

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description:
Generates a faux grid to collide with it when a widget is dragged and
detect row or column that we want to go.
classitems.name: generate_faux_grid

params.name: rows
params.description: Number of columns.

params.name: cols
params.description: Number of rows.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Add cell to the faux grid.
classitems.name: add_faux_cell

params.name: row
params.description: The row for the new faux cell.

params.name: col
params.description: The col for the new faux cell.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Add rows to the faux grid.
classitems.name: add_faux_rows

params.name: rows
params.description: The number of rows you want to add to the faux grid.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Add cols to the faux grid.
classitems.name: add_faux_cols

params.name: cols
params.description: The number of cols you want to add to the faux grid.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description:
Recalculates the offsets for the faux grid. You need to use it when
the browser is resized.
classitems.name: recalculate_faux_grid

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Get all widgets in the DOM and register them.
classitems.name: get_widgets_from_DOM

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description:
Calculate columns and rows to be set based on the configuration
 parameters, grid dimensions, etc ...
classitems.name: generate_grid_and_stylesheet

classitems.description: Destroy this gridster by removing any sign of its presence, making it easy to avoid memory leaks
classitems.name: destroy
